title: What is the back of a semi-truck called? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on what you want to know. On the back end of the Tractor, you have the back rail, the light box, the fifth wheel, and your drive axles. On the trailer, you have the doors, (either roll up or swing), the light boxes, and what’s known as the DOT rail, (which is also known as a Mansfield Rail, simply because they were mandated after Jayne Mansfield and two associates were killed when they had a run-under wreck with a rig. The Rail is supposed to prevent that.) You might want to clarify this. I’m not sure what you want to know.
